alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 18 at 4:39AM MDT until April 19 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 6 inches. Locally higher accumulations to 12 inches possible on the north and west slopes and foothills of the Highwood Mountains and Little Belt Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Cascade County below 5000ft and Western and Central Chouteau County. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to Noon MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute. Gusty winds and wet snow could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Western and Central Chouteau County
